name: Projects
body:
## R

I love the R language. I have looked in varying depths at quite a few languages, and for some strange combination of reasons (CRAN's standard of quality, Rstudio, the "Hadleyverse", functions as first class, ...) I have found myself most satisfied with the work I do in it, and most readily able to translate intent to results.

I'm working on a site which details work I've done in R, reference and summaries of things I've learned, etc. It can be found [here](http://projects.walnutdata.com/R)

### ersilia.city - A simulated city

Utilizing historical data, procedural generation, statistical methods and machine learning techniques, Ersilia (named in homage to Italo Calvino's book, _Invisible Cities_) will be an on-going project with increasing scope, meant to provide data, images, reports, events, etc. on the population, weather, geography, and development of a simulated city. 

### Plot Pictures and Animations

([repo](https://github.com/tmillc/R/tree/master/fun) / [page](http://projects.walnutdata.com/R/plotting.html#ggplot2)) Using R's plotting tools to create interesting graphics (think faces, landscapes, etc). 

TODO: The "page" link is temporary, needs to be fixed. Possibly direct the "repo" to a README.md in that directory

Currently Enrolled:   TODO: A better system for displaying active development

## Other projects

### Rummage Sailor

An app for listing and finding rummage sales. Work began in Ruby on Rails, however I find myself much more interested in a Shiny app version. Future visions include route-planning, timing, scraping other rummage sale listings, user accounts.

## Contact

I love feedback and collaboration. I can be reached in the following ways: 
* by e-mail at christopher@walnutdata.com, 
* on [Linked In](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tmillc)
* on Freenode's IRC as `tmillc`
